In general,  I will push a fix to 202205 today or tomorrow.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> 



> tests_mark_conditions.yaml - this file is a configuration file or its require to add some code?
> In general, I will push a fix to 202205 today or tomorrow.

tests_mark_conditions.yaml  is a configuration file, test script or case will be skipped at the very beginning of test run, it doesn't have to run sanity check and other fixtures, it's best way to skip script or case. Because it will save us time to avoid running sanity check or other fixtures and also it could avoid the errors during these checks or fixtures.

Can you please explain again why the BGP container can not be restarted due to the `start-limit-hit`? I did not quitely understand the following statement:

`This is happening due to BGP service reached start-limit-hit and cannot get started, although TC check whether service have reached start-limit-hit and reset it, at the time of check BGP state is different (it might be Active (running) or inactive (dead)) like in logs below:`

@yozhao101 
This issue I also reproduced. In test code, after one container is restarted, it will execute the post-check, and traverse every feature container to check whether hits start-limit immediately. In image 202012, it passed, test_log shows that within 5s after syncd restarted, it checks bgp hits start-limit successfully, but in image 202205, it needs more than 60s but this code was executed already yet while bgp state was not stable. So that the start-limit check does not work.

> Can you please explain again why the BGP container can not be restarted due to the `start-limit-hit`? I did not quitely understand the following statement:
> 
> `This is happening due to BGP service reached start-limit-hit and cannot get started, although TC check whether service have reached start-limit-hit and reset it, at the time of check BGP state is different (it might be Active (running) or inactive (dead)) like in logs below:`


BGP service have a `StartLimitBurst` value, and if it is exceeded service won't start, for bgp this value is 3 - [bgp.service.j2](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/blob/f30fc7627883c3ac150d712519e652a1157fdee9/files/build_templates/per_namespace/bgp.service.j2#L12)

In order to be able to start, service should be reset by cmd - `sudo systemctl reset-failed bgp.service`
Test case check whether this value is exceeded for each service, and expects to find `start-limit-hit` in output of cmd `sudo systemctl status bgp.service | grep 'Active'`, if it finds it, then TC will reset-failed service, and it will be able to start. 

But at the moment of check, `bgp.service` have other states (like active (running), inactive or deactivating):
```
Active: active (running) since Thu 2022-09-15 10:12:37 UTC; 2min 36s ago
Active: deactivating (stop) since Wed 2022-09-14 15:31:12 UTC; 822ms ago
```

But after around 60-70 seconds, state of bgp.service will be changed to:
`Active: failed (Result: start-limit-hit) since Thu 2022-09-15 10:14:03 UTC; 2min ago`

That's why check for `start-limit-hit` didn't caught this state and didn't reset it, which lead to situating where bgp container is down.
@ZhaohuiS please review

If we add a user defined mark, we should add it into `pytest.ini` ?

> If we add a user defined mark, we should add it into `pytest.ini` ?

Thanks, added the marker now. I believe that the tests ran fine because registering markers in pytest.ini is recommended not required as per https://docs.pytest.org/en/7.1.x/example/markers.html#registering-markers

LGTM .. just a question Is this applicable to packet chassis too ?

> LGTM .. just a question Is this applicable to packet chassis too ?

Yes. This is applicable to all Chassis type.  Fabric cards do not have any base MAC allocated to them.
only LCs and SUP(s) should have base MAC assignment.

```
2022-09-06T01:22:15.3725826Z E               Failed: Processes "['analyze_logs--<MultiAsicSonicHost vlab-02>']" failed with exit code "1"
2022-09-06T01:22:15.3726759Z E               Exception:

Can we add backwards compatibility to this function? For example:
```
if int(re.search(r'20[0-9]{2}[0-1][0-9][0-3][0-9]', duthost.os_version)[0]) < 20220801:
    path='/tmp/portstat-{uid}/{uid}-{filename}'
else:
    path='/tmp/cache/portstat/{uid}-{filename}'
```

> Can we add backwards compatibility to this function? For example:
> 
> ```
> if int(re.search(r'20[0-9]{2}[0-1][0-9][0-3][0-9]', duthost.os_version)[0]) < 20220801:
>     path='/tmp/portstat-{uid}/{uid}-{filename}'
> else:
>     path='/tmp/cache/portstat/{uid}-{filename}'
> ```
The bug fixes: https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/11244, https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/pull/2232, which should be backported to branch 202205. 
For the master branch of sonic-mgmt,  do we still check the os version?
